text: The Luck of the Navy is a 1927 British silent comedy thriller film directed by Fred Paul and starring Evelyn Laye, Henry Victor and Hayford Hobbs. It was an adaptation of the 1919 play The Luck of the Navy by Mrs Clifford Mills. It was shot at Cricklewood Studios. ==Partial cast== * Evelyn Laye – Cynthia Eden * Henry Victor – Lieutenant Clive Stanton * Hayford Hobbs – Louis Peel * Robert Cunningham – Admiral Maybridge * Norma Whalley – Mrs Peel * H. Agar Lyons – Colonel Dupont * William Freshman – Wing Eden * Basil Griffen – Anna * Zoe Palmer – Dora Green ==References== ==External links== * Category:1927 films Category:British films Category:1920s comedy thriller films Category:English- language films Category:British films based on plays Category:Films directed by Fred Paul Category:British silent feature films Category:British comedy thriller films Category:Films shot at Cricklewood Studios Category:Seafaring films Category:British black-and-white films Category:1927 comedy films
title: The Luck of the Navy (film)
